module.p: an siud over there, at that place over there is a demonstrative adverb, derived from the distal demonstrative pronoun siud that (one) over there.
an siud contrasts with an seo here (proximal to the speaker) and an sin there (proximal to the hearer).

section.p:
Pedagogical examples –
Tha Raghnall an siud. | Tha an t-aran an siud.
Ronald is yonder. | The bread is yonder. td. 1, 195

Pedagogical examples –
Tha taigh aig Seumas an siud.
James has a house over there. td. 7 locative adverbial?
